_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:36:18 using v2.1
title: How do people rate their health with EQ-VAS?
analysis_commentary: A different way to look at health status is the EQ-VAS where patients were simply asked to rate their health on a visual analogue scale from worst to best (0 to 100) (see data notes for more information). It is interesting to note that using this measure, for all four conditions patients consistently report less improvement with the operations. However, most benefit from surgery can again be seen seen for hip replacement (average 62% in the first three years) , followed by knee replacement (average 51% in the first three years) and then varicose veins (five-year average 41%) and groin hernia (five-year average 38%) operations.
data_source: Patient Reported Outcome Measures, Health & Social Care Information Centre
